Description: Painted pottery reis shabti with a black curled lappet-wig, a red modelled face with outlined eyes; the chest and crossed arms in relief are yellow, the hands red, the navel is marked, the figure wears a white pleated triangular apron with two tiers, the lower of which is inscribed with a column of black painted Hieroglyphs(now illegible), the feet are red and separate.
Acquisition name: Purchased from: Somerset Lowry-Corry, 2nd Earl of Belmore
